t: Send*pn the lamb to the ruler of the land, From*ld Sela to the wilderness, To*ld the mount of the daughter of Zion.
For*ld it shall be as a wandering bird thrown out of the nest; So*ild shall be the daughters of Moab at the fords of the Arnon.
“Take*ld counsel, execute judgment; Make*ld your shadow like the night in the middle of the day; Hide*ld the outcasts, Do*ld not betray him who escapes.

Let*ld My outcasts dwell with you, O Moab; Be*ld a shelter to them from the face of the spoiler. For*ld the extortioner is at an end, Devastation*ld ceases, The*ld oppressors are consumed out of the land.
In*ld mercy the throne will be established; And*ld One will sit on it in truth, in the tabernacle of David, Judging*ld and seeking justice and hastening righteousness.”
We*ln have heard of the pride of Moab— He*ild is*i very proud— Of*ld his haughtiness and his pride and his wrath; But*ild his lies shall*i not be*i so.
Therefore*ld Moab shall wail for Moab; Everyone*ld shall wail. For*ld the foundations of Kir Hareseth you shall mourn; Surely*ld they*i are*i stricken.

For*ld the fields of Heshbon languish, And*ild the vine of Sibmah; The*ld lords of the nations have broken down its choice plants, Which*ld have reached to Jazer And*ld wandered through the wilderness. Her*ld branches are stretched out, They*ld are gone over the sea.

Therefore*ld I will bewail the vine of Sibmah, With*ld the weeping of Jazer; I*ld will drench you with my tears, O*ld Heshbon and Elealeh; For*ld battle cries have fallen Over*ld your summer fruits and your harvest.

Gladness*ln is taken away, And*ld joy from the plentiful field; In*ld the vineyards there will be no singing, Nor*ld will there be shouting; No*ld treaders will tread out wine in the presses; I*ld have made their shouting cease.
Therefore*ld my heart shall resound like a harp for Moab, And*ld my inner being for Kir Heres.
And*ln it shall come to pass, When*ld it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, That*ld he will come to his sanctuary to pray; But*ld he will not prevail.
This*p is*i the word which the Lord*s has spoken concerning Moab since that time.

But now the Lord*s has spoken, saying, “Within three years, as the years of a hired man, the glory of Moab will be despised with all that great multitude, and the remnant will*i be*i very small and*i feeble.”
